snippet: Tammy Baldwin, a Democrat, and Ron Johnson, a Republican, of Wisconsin personify the polarized Congress, voting against each other more than any other state’s senators.
abstract: Democratic Sen Tammy Baldwin and Republican Sen Ron Johnson, of Wisconsin personify polarized Congress, voting against each other more than any other state’s senators; they represent type of political diversity that has been relatively uncommon in Congress, legacy of 19th-century politics when geography largely determined how people cast their votes for statewide office
lead_paragraph: Tammy Baldwin, a Democrat, and Ron Johnson, a Republican, of Wisconsin personify the polarized Congress, voting against each other more than any other state’s senators.

headline.main: Two Senators Have Little but a State in Common
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin’s Senators Appear to Have Little but Their State in Common
